page.title: 05FARMING IN REDMARLEY by NICK
page.content: The most popular type of farming is corn and keeping cattle.The main type of corn is barley The biggest farm in Redmarley is Hartledge Farm which belongs to A.PRIDAY.He owns a dairy herd of 120 British Fresians and 1 Hereford Bull. He also does a lot of contract work such as:cutting corn,haymaking and silage. There is 1 local market which is held on Mondays Thursdays at Gloucester. There is a lot of managed grass which grazed or made into hay or silage. One of the other farms called Redhill Farm grows potatoes,wheat and rears sheep. There are also a lot of small holdings of 10-20 acres and keep a couple of dairy cows and a couple of calves. Stallards who live at Newent grow 40 acres of wheat in Redmarley.
